channel.title: The Nitch Podcast
channel.description: A weekly podcast about making apps that run everywhere using open web standards like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST, and JSON. Hosted by Jonathan Stark and Kelli Shaver.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A weekly podcast about making apps that run everywhere using open web standards like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST, and JSON. Hosted by Jonathan Stark and Kelli Shaver.
channel.itunes:author: Nitch
channel.itunes:summary: A weekly podcast about making apps that run everywhere using open web standards like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST, and JSON. Hosted by Jonathan Stark and Kelli Shaver.
channel.media:description: A weekly podcast about making apps that run everywhere using open web standards like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, REST, and JSON. Hosted by Jonathan Stark and Kelli Shaver.

item.title: Episode 1: Hello World
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the Nitch concept, touch events, and offline web apps.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the Nitch concept, touch events, and offline web apps.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the Nitch concept, touch events, and offline web apps.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the Nitch concept, touch events, and offline web apps.

item.title: Episode 2: Eyeball Polish
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about HTML source order issues, painless API documentation, frictionless blogging with static Markdown files, people vs users, esoteric htaccess bugs, polishing eyeballs, and more.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about HTML source order issues, painless API documentation, frictionless blogging with static Markdown files, people vs users, esoteric htaccess bugs, polishing eyeballs, and more.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about HTML source order issues, painless API documentation, frictionless blogging with static Markdown files, people vs users, esoteric htaccess bugs, polishing eyeballs, and more.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about HTML source order issues, painless API documentation, frictionless blogging with static Markdown files, people vs users, esoteric htaccess bugs, polishing eyeballs, and more.

item.title: Episode 3: Nicefully Degradationing
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about everything under the sun this week: ghost clicks in Availio, EOF merge conflicts in git, database events with Boutique.js, confusion about CORS, bitmapped text clipping paths on retina iPad, fun with the file API, and much more.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about everything under the sun this week: ghost clicks in Availio, EOF merge conflicts in git, database events with Boutique.js, confusion about CORS, bitmapped text clipping paths on retina iPad, fun with the file API, and much more.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about everything under the sun this week: ghost clicks in Availio, EOF merge conflicts in git, database events with Boutique.js, confusion about CORS, bitmapped text clipping paths on retina iPad, fun with the file API, and much more.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about everything under the sun this week: ghost clicks in Availio, EOF merge conflicts in git, database events with Boutique.js, confusion about CORS, bitmapped text clipping paths on retina iPad, fun with the file API, and much more.

item.title: Episode 4: Passive Aggressive Elbow Guy
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about REST APIs, automated testing, and knowing the rules before you break them.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about REST APIs, automated testing, and knowing the rules before you break them.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about REST APIs, automated testing, and knowing the rules before you break them.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about REST APIs, automated testing, and knowing the rules before you break them.

item.title: Episode 5: Whack A Mole
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about writing API docs before API code, the advantages of progressive enhancement over graceful degradation, and the lost art of writing SQL queries.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about writing API docs before API code, the advantages of progressive enhancement over graceful degradation, and the lost art of writing SQL queries.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about writing API docs before API code, the advantages of progressive enhancement over graceful degradation, and the lost art of writing SQL queries.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about writing API docs before API code, the advantages of progressive enhancement over graceful degradation, and the lost art of writing SQL queries.

item.title: Episode 6: The Dot Is Optional
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about accessing REST APIs over SMS, wrestling with Google Chat bots, confusion about the HTML5 Audio tag, and so much more.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about accessing REST APIs over SMS, wrestling with Google Chat bots, confusion about the HTML5 Audio tag, and so much more.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about accessing REST APIs over SMS, wrestling with Google Chat bots, confusion about the HTML5 Audio tag, and so much more.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about accessing REST APIs over SMS, wrestling with Google Chat bots, confusion about the HTML5 Audio tag, and so much more.

item.title: Episode 7: Suckaphobia
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about audio tag support in Firefox, the allure of nosql key-value store Redis, the emotional impact of SMS vs the mobile web, and enjoy a visit from a very special guest - J's blue Kenmore Intuition vacuum cleaner.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about audio tag support in Firefox, the allure of nosql key-value store Redis, the emotional impact of SMS vs the mobile web, and enjoy a visit from a very special guest - J's blue Kenmore Intuition vacuum cleaner.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about audio tag support in Firefox, the allure of nosql key-value store Redis, the emotional impact of SMS vs the mobile web, and enjoy a visit from a very special guest - J's blue Kenmore Intuition vacuum cleaner.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about audio tag support in Firefox, the allure of nosql key-value store Redis, the emotional impact of SMS vs the mobile web, and enjoy a visit from a very special guest - J's blue Kenmore Intuition vacuum cleaner.

item.title: Episode 8: Barely Broken
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli have a rambling chat about broken feet, bad movies, and bocce night in an attempt to talk about anything but Availio. Spoiler alert: we fail miserably.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli have a rambling chat about broken feet, bad movies, and bocce night in an attempt to talk about anything but Availio. Spoiler alert: we fail miserably.
item.itunes:author: Nitch

item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli have a rambling chat about broken feet, bad movies, and bocce night in an attempt to talk about anything but Availio. Spoiler alert: we fail miserably.

item.title: Episode 9: Naked Dogs
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the internet, shave our dogs, and discuss tools, tools, and more tools: wireframing, prototyping, documentation, debugging, and everyone's favorite - time tracking.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the internet, shave our dogs, and discuss tools, tools, and more tools: wireframing, prototyping, documentation, debugging, and everyone's favorite - time tracking.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the internet, shave our dogs, and discuss tools, tools, and more tools: wireframing, prototyping, documentation, debugging, and everyone's favorite - time tracking.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the internet, shave our dogs, and discuss tools, tools, and more tools: wireframing, prototyping, documentation, debugging, and everyone's favorite - time tracking.

item.title: Episode 10: Tub Slumber
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli explain why the mobile web is really just a warning shot in the wireless revolution, what content creators can do to prepare for interactive Coke bottles, and the difference between portable and mobile devices. But not before we spend some time navel gazing in honor of our tenth episode.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli explain why the mobile web is really just a warning shot in the wireless revolution, what content creators can do to prepare for interactive Coke bottles, and the difference between portable and mobile devices. But not before we spend some time navel gazing in honor of our tenth episode.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli explain why the mobile web is really just a warning shot in the wireless revolution, what content creators can do to prepare for interactive Coke bottles, and the difference between portable and mobile devices. But not before we spend some time navel gazing in honor of our tenth episode.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli explain why the mobile web is really just a warning shot in the wireless revolution, what content creators can do to prepare for interactive Coke bottles, and the difference between portable and mobile devices. But not before we spend some time navel gazing in honor of our tenth episode.

item.title: Episode 11: Kelli With One I
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli suggest a process for developing apps that run everywhere, share anecdotes about the alarming insecurity of telephonic communications, and wonder aloud about what will become of our website when we eventually shed this mortal coil. Grab yer hanky... it's a very special episode of the Nitch Podcast.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli suggest a process for developing apps that run everywhere, share anecdotes about the alarming insecurity of telephonic communications, and wonder aloud about what will become of our website when we eventually shed this mortal coil. Grab yer hanky... it's a very special episode of the Nitch Podcast.

Grab yer hanky... it's a very special episode of the Nitch Podcast.

item.title: Episode 12: Snail Says Meow
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about X header deprecation, Margo ported to Ruby, database migrations with Active Record, and all things AWS.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about X header deprecation, Margo ported to Ruby, database migrations with Active Record, and all things AWS.

item.title: Episode 13: Leftover Shrimp
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about X header deprecation, Margo ported to Ruby, database migrations with Active Record, and all things AWS.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the process of starting a mobile development project, the psychology of native apps vs web apps, and why we think companies should embrace cloud computing ASAP.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the process of starting a mobile development project, the psychology of native apps vs web apps, and why we think companies should embrace cloud computing ASAP.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the process of starting a mobile development project, the psychology of native apps vs web apps, and why we think companies should embrace cloud computing ASAP.

item.title: Episode 14: Got Elephants?
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about ActiveRecord and SQL views, complexity in the database vs the middleware, HATEOAS vs OPTIONS requests, and much MUCH more. Coffee printers, predator pee, and the future of bricks and mortar retailers, for example.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about ActiveRecord and SQL views, complexity in the database vs the middleware, HATEOAS vs OPTIONS requests, and much MUCH more. Coffee printers, predator pee, and the future of bricks and mortar retailers, for example.

item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about ActiveRecord and SQL views, complexity in the database vs the middleware, HATEOAS vs OPTIONS requests, and much MUCH more. Coffee printers, predator pee, and the future of bricks and mortar retailers, for example.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about ActiveRecord and SQL views, complexity in the database vs the middleware, HATEOAS vs OPTIONS requests, and much MUCH more. Coffee printers, predator pee, and the future of bricks and mortar retailers, for example.

item.title: Episode 15: Interesting Or What Have You
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about mobile web debugging tools, the moral conflict of using tables for layout, and development principles vs client demands. Also this week, The Nitch Podcast Drinking Game is born. WARNING: The audio is absolutely atrocious this week, so proceed at your own risk. Sorry!
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about mobile web debugging tools, the moral conflict of using tables for layout, and development principles vs client demands. Also this week, The Nitch Podcast Drinking Game is born. WARNING: The audio is absolutely atrocious this week, so proceed at your own risk. Sorry!

item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about mobile web debugging tools, the moral conflict of using tables for layout, and development principles vs client demands. Also this week, The Nitch Podcast Drinking Game is born. WARNING: The audio is absolutely atrocious this week, so proceed at your own risk. Sorry!

item.title: Episode 16: Terrifying Robot Dog
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli begin with many-to-many self joins with ActiveRecord, "sticky-finger" swipe in the People.com mobile site, and a philosophy of comments for self-documenting code. And then we go totally off the reservation with broadcasting human senses, cars for the blind, and a truly terrifying robot dog. Fun!
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli begin with many-to-many self joins with ActiveRecord, "sticky-finger" swipe in the People.com mobile site, and a philosophy of comments for self-documenting code. And then we go totally off the reservation with broadcasting human senses, cars for the blind, and a truly terrifying robot dog. Fun!
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli begin with many-to-many self joins with ActiveRecord, "sticky-finger" swipe in the People.com mobile site, and a philosophy of comments for self-documenting code. And then we go totally off the reservation with broadcasting human senses, cars for the blind, and a truly terrifying robot dog. Fun!

And then we go totally off the reservation with broadcasting human senses, cars for the blind, and a truly terrifying robot dog. Fun!

item.title: Episode 17: Bad Guy Boss
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the genius of "view source" in web browsers, idealism vs reality in responsive web design, and freedom vs control in the coming wireless society.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the genius of "view source" in web browsers, idealism vs reality in responsive web design, and freedom vs control in the coming wireless society.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the genius of "view source" in web browsers, idealism vs reality in responsive web design, and freedom vs control in the coming wireless society.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli talk about the genius of "view source" in web browsers, idealism vs reality in responsive web design, and freedom vs control in the coming wireless society.

item.title: Episode 18: Why Is The Bathroom Clean?
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli rag on cross-origin resource sharing, defend php as a REST framework language, and open sources oranges. Then we head into the weeds with sms for dogs, digital pills, and trusting your eyesight to a computer.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli rag on cross-origin resource sharing, defend php as a REST framework language, and open sources oranges. Then we head into the weeds with sms for dogs, digital pills, and trusting your eyesight to a computer.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli rag on cross-origin resource sharing, defend php as a REST framework language, and open sources oranges. Then we head into the weeds with sms for dogs, digital pills, and trusting your eyesight to a computer.

item.title: Episode 19: Flintstoning It
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the authors of the CORS spec, explain why the Web vs Native debate is a red herring, and wonder aloud what will happen to all the soon to be unemployed cabbies in Boston.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the authors of the CORS spec, explain why the Web vs Native debate is a red herring, and wonder aloud what will happen to all the soon to be unemployed cabbies in Boston.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the authors of the CORS spec, explain why the Web vs Native debate is a red herring, and wonder aloud what will happen to all the soon to be unemployed cabbies in Boston.
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan and Kelli apologize to the authors of the CORS spec, explain why the Web vs Native debate is a red herring, and wonder aloud what will happen to all the soon to be unemployed cabbies in Boston.

item.title: Episode 20: Disembodied iPads
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about programming for a world where everyone has multiple connected devices, the tension between graphic design vs responsive design, and the challenges of managing open-source projects. But not before we spend 15 or so minutes waffling about juice fasts, coding as a family, and mousing with your face. You've been warned.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about programming for a world where everyone has multiple connected devices, the tension between graphic design vs responsive design, and the challenges of managing open-source projects. But not before we spend 15 or so minutes waffling about juice fasts, coding as a family, and mousing with your face. You've been warned.

But not before we spend 15 or so minutes waffling about juice fasts, coding as a family, and mousing with your face. You've been warned.

item.title: Episode 21: There's A Cream For That
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about everything from the future of online publishing to Cochlear implant hijacking. Sorry, no intro and outro music this week. If you miss it, please complain loudly on Twitter to @nitchapps.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about everything from the future of online publishing to Cochlear implant hijacking. Sorry, no intro and outro music this week. If you miss it, please complain loudly on Twitter to @nitchapps.

item.title: Episode 22: iCarpet
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli warm up with responsive web design, javascript media queries, and smart carpet before diving into Apple: how to learn Objective-C in a long weekend, the awesomeness of Xcode, and why iOS will never be a dominant software platform.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli warm up with responsive web design, javascript media queries, and smart carpet before diving into Apple: how to learn Objective-C in a long weekend, the awesomeness of Xcode, and why iOS will never be a dominant software platform.
item.itunes:author: Nitch
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan and Kelli warm up with responsive web design, javascript media queries, and smart carpet before diving into Apple: how to learn Objective-C in a long weekend, the awesomeness of Xcode, and why iOS will never be a dominant software platform.

item.title: Episode 23: Honey Nut Hateos
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about slogging through kernel logs on AWS, Kelli's mobile first responsive redesign, self-documentation vs static docs for RESTful APIs, the future of web browsers on iOS, why Jonathan is not an hypocrite on the Facebook native app thing, and the heartwarming story of a ragtag bunch of watermelon seeds who beat the odds and go on to win the big game. Wat?
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about slogging through kernel logs on AWS, Kelli's mobile first responsive redesign, self-documentation vs static docs for RESTful APIs, the future of web browsers on iOS, why Jonathan is not an hypocrite on the Facebook native app thing, and the heartwarming story of a ragtag bunch of watermelon seeds who beat the odds and go on to win the big game. Wat?

Wat?

Wat?

item.title: Episode 24: Three Foot Commute
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about sandwich achievements, gratuitous animations, wireless green peas, and a future without graphical user interfaces.

item.itunes:author: Nitch

item.title: Episode 25: Zippermouth
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about what went on in the Dallas biodome, highlights of the iPhone announcement (from 2007), Jonathan redesigns his site live out of sheer embarrassment, and then we get tooly on yoaz: text editors, CSS pre-processors, lightweight blogging engines, and... whatever CodeKit is.

item.title: Episode 26: 900,000 Pixels Wide
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about audio augmented reality, mobile sticker shock, bitching on (and about) Twitter, and the upside of getting hacked.

item.title: Episode 27: Fishing Around In The Woods
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about one million things, including: what the DocBook XML grammar has in common with Beats by Dr. Dre. Yep... seriously.

item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about red flags, cranky moodlies, viral tweets... aaaand PhoneGap, and REST APIs, and interactive SMS bots, and all the usual stuff.

item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about tools, tools, and more tools: EC2, Markdown, MySQL Workbench, Sequel Pro, Sencha Architect, Zend Studio, Geek tool, and more.

item.title: Episode 30: The Mighty Gweed
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about debugging mod_rewrite, securing PHP installations, making Apache directory listings mobile-friendly, and who owns the data in a social application.

item.title: Episode 31: Lonely Sneakers
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about debugging appcache in standalone webapps on iOS, Multi-AZ deployment with Amazon RDS, and the inevitable invasion of 7 inch tablets this holiday season.

item.title: Episode 32: Echo Chamber of Misinformation
item.author: Nitch
item.description: Jonathan and Kelli talk about using DataMapper with CodeIgniter, the pros and cons of CSS grids in Bootstrap, icon font resources for responsive web design, and tips for using CORS with REST APIs.
item.content:encoded: Jonathan and Kelli talk about using DataMapper with CodeIgniter, the pros and cons of CSS grids in Bootstrap, icon font resources for responsive web design, and tips for using CORS with REST APIs.
